monitora.title: Monitora Saúde
monitora.description: Web system for monitoring and evaluating health indicators and processes, providing updated data to support management, strategic planning, and health promotion in Maranhão.
monitora.detailedDescription: Monitora Saúde is a web platform developed for the Maranhão State Health Department, aimed at modernizing and centralizing public health indicators monitoring. The system offers an intuitive interface for real-time data visualization and interactive dashboards that assist managers in strategic decision-making.

hans.title: Hans+ App
hans.description: Hans+ is a platform with a web version and an Android app that supports leprosy treatment, allowing medication recording, symptom monitoring, and access to reliable information about the disease.
hans.detailedDescription: Hans+ is a mobile application developed to support leprosy treatment and provide reliable information about the disease. The project was carried out in partnership with the Pharmacy course at the Federal University of Maranhão (UFMA), with technical support and expertise in the health field. The application allows medication recording, daily symptom monitoring, and access to educational content. It uses Flutter for cross-platform development and Firebase for secure data storage. Hans+ went through stages of requirements gathering, prototyping, and usability testing, being evaluated as a practical, informative tool with great potential to assist patients in leprosy treatment monitoring.

masemfome.title: Maranhão Free from Hunger
masemfome.description: Maranhão Free from Hunger is a system under development aimed at tackling food insecurity in the state, focusing on the registration and monitoring of vulnerable families, nutritional assessment, and integration with public policies.
masemfome.detailedDescription: Maranhão Free from Hunger is being developed as a strategic platform to support integrated actions to fight hunger and food insecurity in the state of Maranhão. The system will allow detailed registration of families in vulnerable situations, individual nutritional monitoring, and tracking of the effectiveness of social actions through dashboards and automated reports. The platform integrates with existing government systems through APIs, enabling the use of already registered data and avoiding duplication of efforts in family assistance.
features: Structured registration of families in food vulnerability
Integration with external API for automatic retrieval of family data by CPF
Import and synchronization of personal data and family addresses
Updating and complementing information not available in the external API
Registration of assessments based on health indicators
Continuous history of care and follow-up
Dynamic dashboards by region and municipality
Integration with existing social policies and programs
Support for decision-making in food security policies

developmentProcess.title: Integration with Government Systems
developmentProcess.description: Development of integration with the general family registry system API, allowing searches by the head of household’s CPF and automatic import of personal and address data. This integration avoids rework and ensures consistency of information across systems.

developmentProcess.title: Platform Development
developmentProcess.description: Construction of the backend and frontend with a focus on performance, security, and usability for field professionals, including data synchronization and update features.

developmentProcess.title: Data and Flow Validation
developmentProcess.description: Implementation of validation routines and completion of imported data, allowing professionals to update or add specific health information not covered in the main system.

developmentProcess.title: Regional Pilot Tests
developmentProcess.description: Initial deployment in pilot regions for feedback collection, functionality validation, and testing of the external system integration in a real environment.
